Ad Text:
Family owned since 1988, Thomas Foods International (TFI) is one of Australia's largest food businesses. With teams across Australia, the US, Canada, China, Japan & Europe. TFI is an organisation that truly embodies its values-driven philosophy & positive working culture. Now, is the perfect time to join this innovative, growing global business.

Discover an exciting career opportunity at our Stawell meat processing plant, your gateway to the stunning Grampians region. You'll work with a passionate and diverse team that's empowered to achieve big things and deliver at pace.

The Role

This is a chance to build a lasting career with a stable company that's investing in its future with significant site expansion and new technology. 

This pivotal role of a Controls and Automation Technician is responsible for designing, developing, & maintaining control systems and automation solutions across the site.  Working on projects involving the integration of hardware & software components to optimise operational efficiency, enhance safety, & improve productivity.

This role requires a strong understanding of electrical engineering principles, programming skills, and knowledge of control systems.

The Quality Ingredients for Success 

Just like our best cuts of meat, there are a few essential qualities that we need and look for in this role:

System Design & Development:

Cross-functional teams system requirements & specifications. Design & develop control systems & automation solutions platforms.

Recommend technologies & methodologies to create system for schematics, diagrams, & technical specifications.

Programming and Configuration::

Develop & implement control algorithms & (ladder) logic programming. Configure & program  (PLCs),  (DCS), (HMIs), & control devices.

Integrate the control system, sensors, actuators, & communication networks.  Conduct debugging of software system functionality.

System Integration and Commissioning:

Suppliers & contractors to integrate control systems into processes. Coordinate system installation, testing, & commissioning activities. 
 

System troubleshooting & resolve issues for performance or interface problems. Fine-tuning parameters, control strategies, & conducting system performance analysis.

Continuous Improvement:

Improve, enhance or modify existing control systems  requirements.  

Maintain system documentation & update, with the latest industry trends, standards, & technologies related to controls & automation. 

Collaboration and Communication:

Multidisciplinary teams, including Elect & Mech engineers, electrical & mechanical trades & software developers for troubleshooting & resolution of control system issues.

Experience & Qualifications

Bach degree in Elect Eng, Automatic Eng, or related field/in-depth industry experience.

Control systems theory, process control, & automation principles. Programming such as ladder logic, structured text, or function block diagram. Experience with PLCs, DCSs, HMIs, & from manufacturers.

Industrial communication protocols (OPC, Modbus, Ethernet/IP). Elect & Elect systems, including sensors, actuators, & motor control.

Read & interpret electrical schematics & technical drawings.  Problem-solving skills & the ability to analyse complex systems.

Communication & teamwork abilities. Strong attention to detail & a commitment to delivering high-quality work.

Knowledge of relevant safety regulations &standards in the industry.

3-5 years’ experience in a similar role 




Apply today to be part of this exciting opportunity!

Your next exciting career move awaits in Stawell! Here, you'll find the perfect blend of a fulfilling career and a relaxed country lifestyle with modern conveniences. It's a place where you can enjoy nature, raise a family, and establish a meaningful career. If this sounds like the perfect fit, we'd love to hear from you.

If this sound like the right opportunity for you, we would love for you to apply for the position.

Thomas Foods Intenational recognise that creating tasty moments for a diverse range of consumers is only possible if our workforce reflects the consumers we serve. We are an equal opportunity employer - because it's right for our consumers, our business, and especially our people.

Microsoft Fabric Data Engineer 

$135,000 + Super

Work from home 4 days a week and Wednesdays in our Ashburton office

Immediate start

Azured are a Microsoft Partner delivering professional and managed services to organisations throughout Australia, ranging from small and medium size businesses through to large enterprises with national and global operations.

Azured is growing our Data & AI capability, and we’re looking for a Microsoft Fabric Data Engineer who loves designing and building modern cloud data solutions, and solving real business problems for customers.

What will you be doing in this role?

Design and build Microsoft Fabric solutions around medallion architectures

Work directly with customers to understand requirements and shape solutions

Develop data pipelines, lakehouses, and warehouses

Develop transformation logic using Notebooks (PySpark), SQL, and Dataflows Gen2

Create and optimise semantic models for reporting teams

Lead customers through data governance uplifts with Purview Unified Catalog

Collaborate with senior engineers and architects across Azure, AI, and modern data platforms

How do you get shortlisted for this role?

2 years hands-on experience with Microsoft Fabric

3 years experience with Delta Lake

3 years experience in data modelling (star schema, dimensional modelling)

2 years experience with Notebook development on Fabric, Synapse or Databricks

2 years experience using Fabric Data Pipelines, Azured Data Factory, Dataflows Gen2

4 years SQL development experience on Microsoft SQL Server or Azure SQL Database

Experience building and maintaining semantic models

Nice to have

Purview or Fabric governance

Azure Synapse, ADF, Databricks, Azure SQL

Experience in professional services, MSP, or consulting environments

Apply now!
